ground_truth: She stands and stares at Andy with a vaguely pleased smile. Andy nods and holds her hand out to receive the coat, but Miranda tosses it and her handbag onto Emily's desk and marches into her office. Andy stares at the coat, which has been slung over Emily's monitor screen and sits stiffly down in her own chair. Miranda comes to the door. Andy reluctantly picks up her telephone receiver and calls Emily, who's running down busy streets with some big bags. Emily is hit by a taxi and rolls onto its bonnet. The scarves flutter around her. Andy waits at the hospital, looking sheepish. Later, she's with Emily, who's lying in bed with a broken leg and some cuts and bruises. A man comes in with a dinner tray. Emily tucks into a jelly pot and some bread. Andy stands up and grabs her clutch bag. Andy's at a gallery show that Lily's curated. Lily leads Doug off, and Andy checks out the art, standing alone to admire the floor-to-ceiling, blown-up black-and-white photographs of street scenes. Christian is at the opening too. He spots Andy. Andy closes her eyes as rugged, fair-haired Christian kisses her cheek before leaving. Lily is seeing the kiss from across the room and walks off angrily. Andy tries to catch up. Nate follows Andy out. He stares at Andy, who gazes back, then glances aside. Nate nods, then turns and walks away. He turns back. Nate walks off. Swallowing her tears, Andy takes the call. An aerial view of Paris by night. The Eiffel Tower alive with sparkling lights. Andy is sitting in the back of a chic, chauffeur-driven car as they travel through the Paris streets and among the Champs-Élysées. She gazes out off the window, wide-eyed with excitement as they pass the city's grand buildings, shops, and hotels and the imposing Arc de Triomphe. Miranda occasionally glances over her spectacles at the view. Andy is sitting behind Nigel and Miranda, who are in the front row for the Valentino show. Models in an array of stunning gowns sashay down the runway as cameras flash. Nigel whispers in Miranda's ear. Andy's in the second row for another show and leans forward in her seat as the models parade up and down in flamboyant evening gowns. Now, Andy's at the Azzaro show, where dresses in a monochrome palette are being shown. Models and celebrities mingle backstage at the Valentino Show. Miranda talks to Valentino. Andy follows Miranda and Nigel as they head into another function past the press pack. Miranda poses for photos. Christian is close beside Andy as a TV journalist collars Nigel and Miranda. They're photographed. Andy hurries after Miranda. Later, Andy enters Miranda's suite carrying some boxes.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: She remains and gazes at Andy with a slightly satisfied grin. Andy acknowledges and extends her hand out to accept the jacket, but Miranda flings it and her purse onto Emily's table and strides into her office. Andy gazes at the jacket, which has been draped over Emily's display screen and sits rigidly down in her own chair. Miranda arrives at the entrance. Andy unwillingly picks up her phone handset and contacts Emily, who's sprinting down bustling avenues with some large bags. Emily is struck by a cab and rolls onto its hood. The scarves flutter around her. Andy waits at the infirmary, appearing embarrassed. Later, she's with Emily, who's reclining in bed with a fractured leg and some cuts and bruises. A gentleman arrives with a meal tray. Emily dives into a gelatin pot and some bread. Andy stands up and seizes her clutch. Andy's at an exhibit that Lily's curated. Lily guides Doug away, and Andy examines the artwork, standing alone to admire the floor-to-ceiling, enlarged black-and-white pictures of urban scenes. Christian is at the event too. He notices Andy. Andy shuts her eyes as rugged, fair-haired Christian pecks her cheek before departing. Lily is witnessing the kiss from across the room and storms off angrily. Andy attempts to catch up. Nate trails Andy out. He gazes at Andy, who looks back, then glances aside. Nate acknowledges, then turns and walks away. He turns back. Nate walks off. Swallowing her sobs, Andy takes the call. A bird's-eye view of Paris by night. The Eiffel Tower vibrant with twinkling lights. Andy is sitting in the back of a stylish, chauffeur-driven vehicle as they journey through the Paris roads and along the Champs-Élysées. She gazes out of the window, wide-eyed with excitement as they pass the city's magnificent structures, boutiques, and accommodations and the imposing Arc de Triomphe. Miranda occasionally glances over her glasses at the view. Andy is sitting behind Nigel and Miranda, who are in the front row for the Valentino show. Models in an array of stunning dresses sashay down the catwalk as cameras flash. Nigel murmurs in Miranda's ear. Andy's in the second row for another show and leans forward in her seat as the models parade up and down in flamboyant evening dresses. Now, Andy's at the Azzaro show, where gowns in a monotone spectrum are being shown. Models and celebrities mingle backstage at the Valentino Show. Miranda converses with Valentino. Andy follows Miranda and Nigel as they head into another event past the media pack. Miranda poses for pictures. Christian is close beside Andy as a TV reporter collars Nigel and Miranda. They're photographed. Andy rushes after Miranda. Later, Andy enters Miranda's suite carrying some parcels.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: She stands with a vaguely pleased smile at Andy, who nods and reaches for her coat. Instead, Miranda tosses it and her handbag onto Emily's desk and strides into her office. Andy stares at the coat draped over Emily's monitor and sits down. Miranda appears at the door. Andy reluctantly phones Emily, running down busy streets with big bags. Emily is hit by a taxi and ends up on its bonnet, her scarves fluttering. Andy waits at the hospital, looking sheepish. She's later with Emily, lying in bed with a broken leg and some cuts and bruises. A man brings a dinner tray, and Emily eats jelly and bread. Andy grabs her clutch bag and heads to a gallery show curated by Lily. Lily leads Doug away, leaving Andy to admire the floor-to-ceiling black-and-white photos of street scenes. Christian, also at the opening, spots Andy. He kisses her cheek before leaving. Lily sees the kiss and walks off angrily. Andy tries to follow, and Nate follows her out. They exchange glances before Nate walks away. Swallowing her tears, Andy takes a call. An aerial view of Paris by night shows the Eiffel Tower glittering. Andy, in a chic chauffeur-driven car, gazes wide-eyed out the window, passing grand buildings, shops, hotels, and the Arc de Triomphe. In the Valentino show, Andy sits behind Nigel and Miranda as models in stunning gowns walk the runway. Nigel whispers to Miranda. Andy leans forward in her seat at another show, watching models in flamboyant evening gowns. At the Azzaro show, monochrome dresses are displayed. Backstage at the Valentino Show, models, and celebrities mingle. Miranda talks to Valentino, while Andy follows Miranda and Nigel through a press pack. Miranda poses for photos as Christian stays close to Andy. A TV journalist approaches Nigel and Miranda for photos. Andy hurries after Miranda. Later, she enters Miranda's suite carrying some boxes.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: She stands, smiling at Andy, who nods and reaches for the coat. Miranda tosses it and her handbag onto Emily's desk and enters her office. Andy stares at the coat on Emily's monitor and sits at her desk. Miranda reappears, prompting Andy to call Emily, seen running with bags. Emily is hit by a taxi, scarves fluttering. At the hospital, Andy looks sheepish. Later, with bed-bound Emily, a man brings dinner. Emily eats jelly and bread. Andy grabs her clutch. At a gallery, Andy admires street scene photos alone. Christian spots and kisses her cheek, upsetting Lily, who leaves angrily. Andy tries to follow, Nate watches but walks away. Andy takes a call, eyes tearing. She sees Paris and the lit Eiffel Tower from a chauffeur-driven car, excited by the sights. Miranda glances out occasionally. At the Valentino show, Andy sits behind Nigel and Miranda, watching the models. Nigel whispers to Miranda. Andy leans in for another show, observing models in evening gowns. At the Azzaro show, monochrome dresses are displayed. Models and celebrities mingle. Miranda talks with Valentino. Andy follows Miranda and Nigel past the press. Miranda poses for photos. Christian stands by Andy as journalists photograph Miranda and Nigel. Andy follows Miranda, later entering Miranda's suite with boxes.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: She stands there, pausing for a moment to gaze at Andy with a smile that can only be described as vaguely pleased. Andy nods in silent acknowledgment and extends her hand with the expectation of receiving the coat, but Miranda, with her characteristic indifference, nonchalantly tosses both her coat and her handbag onto Emily's desk. Without missing a beat, Miranda marches decisively into her office. Andy can’t help but stare at the coat, now draped over Emily's computer monitor, before she sits down rigidly in her own chair. Just then, Miranda reappears at the doorway. With a reluctant sigh, Andy picks up her telephone receiver and makes a call to Emily, who is seen dashing down bustling streets, her arms loaded with cumbersome bags. An unexpected turn of events sees Emily being struck by a taxi, causing her to roll onto its bonnet, her scarves fluttering around her in the aftermath. Meanwhile, Andy finds herself waiting at the hospital, her demeanor sheepish and contrite. Later on, she’s in the hospital room with Emily, who now lies in bed nursing a broken leg along with several cuts and bruises. A hospital staff member enters the room with a dinner tray, and Emily eagerly digs into a jelly pot and some slices of bread. Seizing the moment, Andy stands up and clutches her handbag tightly. The scene shifts to a gallery show curated by Lily, where Andy finds herself. Lily leads Doug away, leaving Andy to peruse the art alone, surrounded by floor-to-ceiling blown-up black-and-white photographs of urban street scenes. Christian is also present at the opening, and he soon notices Andy. As he moves in to greet her, Andy closes her eyes, feeling his rugged, fair-haired presence as he plants a gentle kiss on her cheek before departing. Lily witnesses the exchange from across the room and walks off in a huff, visibly upset. Andy tries her best to catch up with her, but Nate appears, following Andy outside. He fixes his gaze on Andy, who returns his look but soon glances aside. Nate gives a knowing nod, turns to leave, and then, as if thinking better of it, turns back momentarily before finally walking away. Swallowing back her tears, Andy answers the call that’s come in. The scene transitions to an aerial view of Paris by night, the iconic Eiffel Tower shimmering with a spectacular display of sparkling lights. Andy is sitting in the plush backseat of a stylish, chauffeur-driven car, as they glide through the enchanting streets of Paris, passing the illustrious Champs-Élysées. Her eyes are wide with amazement, taking in the grand architecture of the city’s buildings, shops, and hotels, as well as the formidable Arc de Triomphe. Occasionally, Miranda, seated nearby, peers over her spectacles to take in the view as well. Andy is positioned behind Nigel and Miranda, who occupy front-row seats at the prestigious Valentino show. Models parade down the runway, adorned in an array of breathtaking gowns, while cameras capture every moment. Nigel leans over to whisper something in Miranda's ear. For another show, Andy finds herself in the second row, leaning eagerly forward in her seat as models showcase flamboyant evening gowns. The scene shifts to the Azzaro show, where models present dresses in a sleek monochrome palette. Backstage at the Valentino Show, models mix with celebrities, creating a bustling atmosphere. Miranda talks animatedly with Valentino himself. Following behind, Andy trails after Miranda and Nigel as they make their way through yet another event, weaving past a throng of press. Miranda pauses to pose for photos, while Christian remains close at Andy’s side. A TV journalist intercepts both Nigel and Miranda to capture a few interviews and photographs. Andy, moving with urgency, follows closely behind Miranda. Later, she enters Miranda's luxurious suite, her arms laden with several boxes, ready for the next task at hand.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: She stands there, taking a momentary pause to gaze at Andy with a smile that exudes a vague sense of pleasure, almost enigmatic in its subtlety. Andy, recognizing the unspoken cue, nods in silent acknowledgment and instinctively extends her hand, anticipating the transfer of the coat. However, Miranda, in her typically indifferent manner, casually tosses both her coat and her handbag onto the cluttered surface of Emily's desk without a second thought. With unwavering determination, Miranda then strides purposefully into her office, not missing a single beat. Andy, seemingly captivated, can't help but let her gaze linger on the coat, now casually draped over Emily's computer monitor, before she finally lowers herself with rigidity into her own chair. Just at that moment, Miranda reemerges at the doorway. Letting out a reluctant sigh, Andy picks up her telephone receiver to make a call to Emily, who is depicted as hurrying down the bustling city streets, her arms burdened with cumbersome bags. In an unforeseen turn of events, Emily is struck by a taxi, causing her to roll dramatically onto its bonnet as her scarves flutter wildly in the aftermath. Meanwhile, Andy finds herself anxiously waiting at the hospital, her demeanor one of sheepishness and contrition. Later, she is situated in the hospital room with Emily, who now lies in bed nursing a broken leg along with several noticeable cuts and bruises. A staff member from the hospital enters the room, bringing with them a dinner tray, which prompts Emily to eagerly delve into a jelly pot accompanied by some slices of bread. Sensing the moment, Andy rises to her feet, gripping her handbag tightly as if preparing for what comes next. The scene transitions seamlessly to a gallery show curated by Lily, where Andy finds herself amidst a sea of artistic offerings. Lily guides Doug away, leaving Andy to leisurely peruse the artwork alone, surrounded by floor-to-ceiling blown-up black-and-white photographs depicting urban street scenes. Christian is also present at the event and, before long, he notices Andy. As he moves in to greet her, Andy closes her eyes, feeling his rugged, fair-haired presence as he plants a gentle kiss on her cheek before making his departure. Observing the exchange from across the room, Lily walks off in a huff, her visible frustration leaving no room for doubt. Andy tries earnestly to catch up with her, but Nate appears, following Andy outside. He fixes his steady gaze on Andy, who returns his look briefly before turning her glance aside. Nate gives a knowing nod, turns to leave, and then, as if reconsidering, turns back momentarily before finally walking away. Swallowing her impending tears, Andy responds to the call that comes in. The scene transitions again, this time to an enchanting aerial view of Paris by night, with the iconic Eiffel Tower shimmering brilliantly in a spectacular display of sparkling lights. Andy is comfortably seated in the plush backseat of a stylish, chauffeur-driven car, gliding effortlessly through the enchanting streets of Paris, passing by the illustrious Champs-Élysées. Her eyes are wide with amazement as she takes in the grand architecture of the city’s opulent buildings, luxurious shops, and prestigious hotels, as well as the formidable Arc de Triomphe. Occasionally, Miranda, who is seated nearby, peers over her spectacles to admire the view as well. Andy is positioned just behind Nigel and Miranda, who occupy the coveted front-row seats at the prestigious Valentino show. Models parade elegantly down the runway, adorned in an array of breathtaking gowns, while cameras relentlessly capture every stunning moment. Nigel leans over to whisper something discreetly into Miranda's ear. For another glamorous show, Andy finds herself seated in the second row, leaning forward eagerly as models showcase flamboyant evening gowns with great flair. The scene shifts seamlessly to the Azzaro show, where models present elegant dresses in a sleek monochrome palette. Backstage at the Valentino Show, a vibrant atmosphere is created as models intermingle with celebrities. Miranda engages animatedly with Valentino himself. Following closely behind, Andy trails after Miranda and Nigel as they navigate through yet another event, weaving skillfully past a throng of eager press members. Miranda pauses to pose gracefully for photos, while Christian remains steadfastly at Andy’s side. A TV journalist seizes the opportunity to intercept both Nigel and Miranda, capturing a series of interviews and photographs. Andy, moving with a sense of urgency, follows closely in Miranda's footsteps. Later, she steps into Miranda's opulent suite, her arms filled with several boxes—an indication of the next task awaiting her attention.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: She stands motionless for a brief moment and directs her gaze toward Andy, allowing a vague smile of contentment to spread across her face. In response, Andy acknowledges the gesture with a nod and extends her hand in anticipation to receive the coat. However, instead of handing it over, Miranda abruptly tosses the coat along with her handbag onto Emily's desk with a flick of her wrist, bypassing Andy entirely. She then strides purposefully into her office without pausing. Andy's eyes remain fixed on the coat, observing as it precariously hangs over Emily's monitor screen. With a sense of resignation, she slowly lowers herself into her own chair, feeling the stiffness in her posture. As Miranda reemerges to the door, Andy hesitates momentarily before lifting the phone receiver with marked reluctance. She dials to contact Emily, who at that very moment is portrayed as racing down bustling streets heavily laden with large bags. In a sudden turn of events, Emily is struck by a taxi, her body tumbling onto the vehicle's bonnet as the colorful scarves she carries scatter and flutter around her in the air. Awaiting news at the hospital, Andy exudes an air of self-consciousness and unease. Later, she is seen in the hospital room with Emily, who lies in bed visibly injured, her leg in a cast and her skin etched with cuts and bruises. A man enters the room, bringing with him a dinner tray. Emily, despite her injuries, eagerly begins to consume a jelly pot and some slices of bread. Observing this, Andy pushes herself up to a standing position and reaches for her clutch bag with intent. She transitions to the art gallery where Lily, having curated the show, is actively engaged. Lily takes Doug away, leaving Andy to immerse herself in the art alone, finding herself drawn to the imposing floor-to-ceiling, black-and-white photographs depicting vibrant street scenes. Meanwhile, Christian makes an appearance at the event and, upon spotting Andy, approaches her. In a moment of intimacy, Andy briefly closes her eyes as Christian, rugged with fair hair, plants a kiss on her cheek before departing the scene. From across the room, Lily catches sight of this interaction and exits the gallery abruptly, anger evident in her stride. Andy, determined to address the situation, sets off to follow her. However, Nate intercepts Andy's path as she leaves, fixing her with a steady gaze. She returns his look before her eyes shift away, suggesting unspoken tension. Nate acknowledges this with a nod, initially moving to leave but soon pauses, turning back momentarily before finally walking away. Amidst the swirl of emotions, Andy swallows hard to contain her rising tears and manages to take an incoming call. The scene shifts dramatically to an aerial view showcasing the illuminated splendor of Paris at night, with the Eiffel Tower dazzling in a spectacle of sparkling lights. Andy finds herself nestled in the plush back seat of an elegantly appointed, chauffeur-driven vehicle, gliding through the enchanting streets of Paris, specifically threading through the iconic Champs-Élysées. Her eyes are wide with excitement and awe, drinking in the magnitude of the city's grand architectural marvels, the opulent array of shops and hotels, and the majestic Arc de Triomphe standing proud in its historical significance. Occasionally, Miranda, seated nearby, casts a discerning glance over the frames of her glasses, taking in the view with studied detachment as they proceed. In another setting, Andy is positioned behind Nigel and Miranda, her vantage point lending her a view of the front-row magic at the Valentino show. Models elegantly navigate the runway, showcasing a stunning variety of gowns under the relentless flash of cameras. Nigel leans in close to whisper something into Miranda's ear, words lost to Andy's distance. Relocating to the second row of another show, Andy leans forward in her seat, fully engaged as models traverse the catwalk, their flamboyant evening gowns demanding attention. Shifting focus, Andy attends the Azzaro show, where the runway is an exhibition of dresses rendered in a striking monochrome palette. Backstage at the Valentino Show, a mingling of models and celebrities unfolds amid the fashion whirlwind, while Miranda engages in conversation with Valentino himself. Andy trails closely behind Miranda and Nigel as they navigate through another high-profile function, expertly avoiding the press who jostle for a coveted glimpse. Miranda seamlessly transitions into the spotlight, posing for a flurry of photographs. Meanwhile, Christian positions himself in proximity to Andy as a TV journalist manages to capture Nigel and Miranda's attention, resulting in another round of photographs being taken. Andy then hastens to follow Miranda's advance. In a subsequent scene, Andy enters Miranda's expansive suite, carrying boxes that presumably contain fashion essentials.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
She stands and smiles at Andy, who nods and reaches out for the coat. However, Miranda tosses it and her handbag onto Emily's desk before marching into her office. Andy stares at the discarded coat and then sits at her desk. Upon seeing Miranda at the door, Andy reluctantly calls Emily, who is rushing down busy streets with large bags. Emily is hit by a taxi, causing her scarves to flutter as she rolls onto its bonnet. Andy waits sheepishly at the hospital, where Emily, with a broken leg and some cuts and bruises, is later seen eating from a dinner tray. Andy stands to leave with her clutch bag. 

At a gallery show curated by Lily, Andy observes the art and admires the enlarged black-and-white photographs alone. Christian notices Andy and kisses her cheek before departing, leaving Lily to witness the gesture and walk off angrily. Andy attempts to follow her. Outside, Nate approaches Andy, exchanging a glance before nodding and walking away. As he turns back briefly, he walks off again, prompting Andy to swallow her tears and take a call.

In Paris, Andy rides in a chic, chauffeur-driven car, wide-eyed with excitement as she views the city’s illuminated landmarks, including the Eiffel Tower and the Arc de Triomphe, while Miranda occasionally glances at the scenery. In the front row of the Valentino show, Andy sits behind Nigel and Miranda, watching as models in stunning gowns sashay down the runway. At another show, Andy leans forward in anticipation as models parade in flamboyant evening gowns. At the Azzaro show, monochrome dresses take the spotlight. Backstage, models and celebrities mingle at the Valentino Show, where Miranda converses with Valentino. Following Miranda and Nigel past the press, Andy observes Miranda posing for photos. Andy stays near Christian as journalists photograph Miranda and Nigel. Andy hurriedly follows Miranda and later enters her suite carrying boxes.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: She stands and stares at Andy with a vaguely pleased smile. Andy nods and holds her hand out to receive the coat, but Miranda, the editor-in-chief of a renowned fashion magazine, tosses it and her handbag onto Emily's desk and marches into her office. Andy stares at the coat, which has been slung over Emily's monitor screen, a prized model known for its high resolution, and sits stiffly down in her own chair. Miranda comes to the door. Andy reluctantly picks up her telephone receiver, a vintage rotary model they've kept for its aesthetic, and calls Emily, who's running down the bustling streets of New York City with some big bags. Emily is hit by a taxi, part of the iconic fleet that paints the city's streets yellow, and rolls onto its bonnet. The scarves, which are from the latest designer collection, flutter around her. Andy waits at the hospital, looking sheepish. Later, she's with Emily, who's lying in bed with a broken leg and some cuts and bruises. A man comes in with a dinner tray from the hospital's in-house catering. Emily tucks into a jelly pot and some bread. Andy stands up and grabs her clutch bag. Andy's at a gallery show that Lily, her friend and an emerging art curator, has curated. Lily leads Doug, a mutual friend and an art enthusiast, off, and Andy checks out the art, standing alone to admire the floor-to-ceiling, blown-up black-and-white photographs of street scenes reminiscent of 1950s Paris. Christian is at the opening too. He spots Andy. Andy closes her eyes as rugged, fair-haired Christian, a rising star in the literary world, kisses her cheek before leaving. Lily is seeing the kiss from across the room and walks off angrily. Andy tries to catch up. Nate, Andy's boyfriend who works as a chef, follows Andy out. He stares at Andy, who gazes back, then glances aside. Nate nods, then turns and walks away. He turns back. Nate walks off. Swallowing her tears, Andy takes the call. An aerial view of Paris by night unveils the mesmerizing cityscape. The Eiffel Tower, a global cultural icon of France, comes alive with sparkling lights. Andy is sitting in the back of a chic, chauffeur-driven car as they travel through the Paris streets and among the Champs-Élysées, a world-famous avenue known for its theaters, cafés, and luxury shops. She gazes out off the window, wide-eyed with excitement as they pass the city's grand buildings, shops, and hotels and the imposing Arc de Triomphe, a monument honoring those who fought and died for France. Miranda occasionally glances over her spectacles at the view. Andy is sitting behind Nigel and Miranda, who are in the front row for the Valentino show, one of the most prestigious events in the fashion world. Models in an array of stunning gowns sashay down the runway as cameras flash. Nigel, a veteran fashion editor with keen insights, whispers in Miranda's ear. Andy's in the second row for another show and leans forward in her seat as the models parade up and down in flamboyant evening gowns. Now, Andy's at the Azzaro show, where dresses in a monochrome palette are being shown, reflecting the season's trend toward minimalist elegance. Models and celebrities mingle backstage at the Valentino Show. Miranda talks to Valentino, the legendary designer himself. Andy follows Miranda and Nigel as they head into another function past the press pack. Miranda poses for photos, her authoritative presence commanding the attention of the photographers. Christian is close beside Andy as a TV journalist collars Nigel and Miranda, eager for a soundbite. They're photographed, capturing the evening's glamor. Andy hurries after Miranda. Later, Andy enters Miranda's suite, a lavish accommodation befitting her status, carrying some boxes from exclusive boutiques.

Andy trails Miranda and Nigel as they progress into another gathering past the press swarm. Miranda poses for images. Christian is nearby Andy as a radio broadcaster approaches Nigel and Miranda. They're snapped. Andy rushes after Miranda. Later, Andy enters Miranda's suite carrying some bags.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: She perches and glances at Derek with a somewhat confused grin. Derek shrugs and stretches his arm out to catch the umbrella, but Barbara flings it and her backpack onto Helen's table and strides into her studio. Derek glances at the umbrella, which has been draped over Helen's lamp and sinks awkwardly down in his own stool. Barbara saunters to the window. Derek hesitantly lifts his radio antenna and contacts Helen, who's sprinting down crowded avenues with numerous cushions. Helen is struck by a scooter and somersaults onto its roof. The ribbons dance around her. Derek idles at the clinic, feeling embarrassed. Later, he's with Helen, who's reclining in a hammock with a sprained wrist and some grazes and bumps. A woman enters with a snack platter. Helen digs into a pudding cup and some crackers. Derek rises and snatches his tote bag. Derek's at a boutique event that Carla's orchestrated. Carla guides Steve away, and Derek inspects the sculptures, standing alone to appreciate the wall-to-wall, oversized sepia images of park landscapes. Alex is at the gathering too. He notices Derek. Derek blinks as rugged, dark-haired Alex pecks his forehead before departing. Carla observes the peck from across the hall and storms away furiously. Derek attempts to follow. Sam trails Derek outside. He watches Derek, who peers back, then shifts his gaze. Sam shakes his head, then pivots and strides away. He glances back. Sam strides off. Fighting back his laughter, Derek answers the text. A bird's-eye view of London by dusk. The Tower Bridge glowing with twinkling bulbs. Derek is sitting in the back of a sleek, driver-led van as they cruise through the London lanes and along the Buckingham Palace Road. He peers out through the glass, wide-eyed with awe as they pass the city's majestic towers, eateries, and inns and the towering Big Ben. Barbara sporadically peeks over her opera glasses at the cityscape. Derek is sitting behind Colin and Barbara, who are in the front row for the Chanel exhibition. Performers in a spectrum of dazzling suits glide down the stage as flashes pop. Colin murmurs in Barbara's ear. Derek's in the third row for another event and leans backward in his bench as the performers glide up and down in vibrant party suits. Now, Derek's at the Dior exhibition, where outfits in a rainbow pattern are being exhibited. Artists and officials mingle backstage at the Chanel Exhibition. Barbara converses with Chanel. Derek shadows Barbara and Colin as they move into another gathering amid the paparazzi crowd. Barbara pauses for pictures. Alex remains close to Derek as a radio presenter grabs Colin and Barbara. They're filmed. Derek dashes after Barbara. Later, Derek steps into Barbara's lounge carrying numerous crates.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Andy, with a vague smile, attempts to take Miranda's coat, but Miranda throws it onto Emily's desk and enters her office. Andy calls Emily, who is rushing through the streets, only to be hit by a taxi. At the hospital, Andy visits Emily, now lying in bed with injuries. Andy later attends a gallery show curated by Lily, where Christian kisses her cheek, angering Lily. Nate, observing from afar, walks away after exchanging glances with Andy. In Paris, Andy experiences the city's vibrant night scenes while in a chauffeur-driven car, excitedly observing landmarks. She attends fashion shows with Miranda and Nigel, witnessing models in elegant gowns. At the Valentino show, Andy navigates the bustling backstage and follows Miranda into events, encountering Christian and mingling with celebrities. Eventually, she enters Miranda's suite carrying boxes.

and sits stiffly down in her own chair Andy nods and holds her hand out to receive the coat but Miranda tosses it and her handbag onto Emily's desk and marches into her office She stands and stares at Andy with a vaguely pleased smile
